abstract: The S.E.C. said Monday that Evergreen Asset Management had been charged with securities law violations for overstating the value of a mutual fund that invested primarily in mortgage-backed securities and had settled the case for $40 million without admitting or denying wrongdoing.
snippet: The S.E.C. said Monday that Evergreen Asset Management had been charged with securities law violations for overstating the value of a mutual fund that invested primarily in mortgage-backed securities and had settled the case for $40 million withou...
lead_paragraph: Wells Fargo seems to have inherited more toxic mortgage-related baggage from its acquisition of Wachovia than it previously thought.

headline.main: Evergreen to Pay $40 Million to Settle S.E.C. Case
